column1: Fridley is a city in Anoka County
column2: Minnesota
column3: United States. The population was 27
column4: 208 at the 2010 census. Fridley was incorporated in 1949 as a village and became a city in 1957. It is part of the Twin Cities Metropolitan Area. Fridley is a "first ring" or "inner ring" suburb in the northern part of the Twin Cities. Fridley connects with the city of Minneapolis at its southern border. Neighboring first ring suburbs are Columbia Heights to the South and Brooklyn Center to the West across the Mississippi river.

column1: According to the United States Census Bureau
column2: the city has a total area of 10.89 square miles (28.20 km2)
column3: of which 10.17 square miles (26.34 km2) is land and 0.72 square miles (1.86 km2) is water.The city is within a narrow portion of the southernmost part of Anoka County. It is longer North/South along the path of the Mississippi River
column4: and the highways that follow the river. It is narrower East/West in the portion between the boundaries of the Mississippi River and the City of Spring Lake Park.

column1: The city of Fridley borders the cities of Coon Rapids and Blaine to the north; Spring Lake Park to the northeast; Mounds View and New Brighton to the east; Columbia Heights to the southeast; Minneapolis to the southwest; and Brooklyn Park and Brooklyn Center to the West.
Lakes in Fridley include East Moore Lake
column2: West Moore Lake
column3: and Locke Lake.  Rice Creek flows through the central part of the city
column4: Springbrook Creek flows through the northwest section
column5: and the Mississippi River borders Fridley to the west. Portions of islands in the Mississippi River
column6: including the Islands of Peace and Banfill Island are within the borders of the city.

column1: Fridley shares its climate with nearby Minneapolis. It has a hot-summer humid continental climate zone (Dfa in the Köppen climate classification)
column2: typical of southern parts of the Upper Midwest
column3: and is situated in USDA plant hardiness zone 4b. As is typical in a continental climate
column4: the difference between average temperatures in the coldest winter month and the warmest summer month is great: 60.1 °F (33.4 °C).

column1: The post-European/American settlement history of Fridley begins with the construction of the Red River Ox Cart Trail in 1844. The trail traveled through Minnesota Territory from St. Paul to Pembina in present day North Dakota). The road was used to transport furs to the south and other various supplies to the Red River Valley settlers in the north. The East River Road (Anoka County Highway 1) follows this route today within Fridley
column2: from the border with Minneapolis to the border with Coon Rapids.
John Banfill became the first settler in the area
column3: which was known at the time as Manomin.  Manomin is a variant spelling of manoomin
column4: the Ojibwe word for wild rice
column5: a staple of their diet.  It comprised the modern-day municipalities of Columbia Heights

column1: The area soon grew quickly in size.  In 1851
column2: Banfill platted the actual town of Manomin.  There
column3: a general store and sawmill were built next to Rice Creek
column4: named after Henry Mower Rice
column5: a settler who just two years earlier had acquired a lot of land in the area.  In 1853
column6: the first town post office was in operation
column8: a ferry crossing the Mississippi River was established.

column2: Abram M. Fridley
column3: for whom the city is named
column4: was elected as the first territorial representative for the area.

column2: the area separated from Ramsey County; Manomin County was established
column3: and it became the smallest county in the United States
column4: having only 18 sections.  This distinction was short-lived
column5: after it was annexed by Anoka County in 1870 and became a township with the same name.

column1: The Saint Paul and Pacific Railroad
column2: which joined St. Paul to St. Anthony across from Minneapolis in 1862
column3: began extending rail to Anoka
column4: reaching it through Fridley in 1864.In 1879
column5: the Minnesota State Legislature
column6: of which Abram M. Fridley was still a member
column7: changed the township's name to bear his last name.

column2: the Fridley Township was incorporated as the Village of Fridley.  The Fridley Free Press was also established.  A lawsuit that challenged the incorporation of the village caused the funds to be frozen.  Minnesota state law allowed cities to operate municipal liquor stores following the end of Prohibition.  The Fridley Liquor store proceeds were the primary funding for the daily city operations until the lawsuit was resolved in 1950. In Minnesota there are both private liquor stores or city-owned municipal liquor stores. Fridley is the location of the headquarters of the Minnesota Municipal Beverage Association (MMBA)
column3: a lobbying coalition for municipalities with city-owned liquor stores. In conjunction with the Minnesota Licensed Beverage Association
column4: they lobbied against Sunday liquor store sales in Minnesota until it was finally permitted in 2017.

column2: the village became as the City of Fridley
column3: a "home rule charter city". The City Hall at 6431 University Avenue Northeast is dedicated with fire station
column4: city services and council meetings. A newer fire station is built in 1964.

column1: Two of the worst disasters to hit the city happened within weeks of each other. In April 1965
column2: all of Minnesota was affected by a "500 year flood". The spring 1965 flood on the Upper Mississippi is still the flood of record for from about 100 miles north of Minneapolis
column3: Minnesota to Hannibal
column4: Missouri. The crests of that April exceeded previous records by several feet at many river gauge sites. Those record crests still exceed the second highest crest by a foot or more at many of those same sites. An ice jam rising 24 feet over the river broke up when it rammed a series of ice breakers above the Sartell Dam. The Riverview Heights area where Springbrook creek enters the river was severely flooded.

column3: Fridley was hit by two F4 tornadoes.  One out of every four homes in the city was destroyed or damaged.  The second twister that hit was the deadliest storm in Twin Cities history (see 1965 Twin Cities tornado outbreak)
column4: which killed a total of 13 people. Portions of the City Hall and Fire Station were damaged.In 1967 the new Civic Center Building opens at the City Hall location with a plaza located to the south. This building was remodeled in 1989. The building was demolished in 2019.

column1: ==== Springbrook Nature Center and Springbrook Tornado ====

column2: Fridley began purchasing land which would become the Springbrook Nature Center. On July 18
column4: a widely photographed tornado spent 16 minutes in Springbrook Nature Center
column5: destroying thousands of century old trees and extensive areas of mature forest habitat. Well-known aerial footage of the tornado was filmed by a KARE 11 television news helicopter passing through the area.

column2: Medtronic opened its new World Headquarters on the site of the 100 Twin Drive-in at Interstate 694 and Minnesota Highway 65. As of 2019
column3: it is still the Operational Headquarters for the Medtronic
column4: PLC
column5: which re-organized as an Irish Company in 2015.

column3: President George W. Bush visited the Micro Controls company in Fridley. He was promoting one of the tax relief changes made during his administration. He flew into Minnesota for only a few hours on Air Force One before returning to Washington.

column2: the Minnesota Sports Cafe was a notable venue for Mixed martial arts competitions. Fighters who have claimed victories in Fridley include Sean Sherk
column3: Nick Thompson (fighter)
column4: Brock Larson
column5: Marcus LeVesseur

column3: Fridley was struck by straight-line winds exceeding 80 mph (130 km/h)
column4: toppling many old growth trees as large as 2.5 feet (0.76 m) in diameter and in turn
column5: destroying dozens of homes and several vehicles.  Cleanup efforts took as long as a week
column6: leaving hundreds of residents stranded in their homes without power
column7: unable to drive until streets were cleared of debris.  This same storm also affected Brooklyn Center
column12: as well as other communities in the surrounding North Metro area.

column1: Fridley has one of the first six stations of the Northstar Commuter Rail line connecting the northwest suburbs and downtown Minneapolis; the line opened in November 2009.On July 17
column3: heavy rains caused a washout of the BNSF rail bridge over Rice Creek. A train derailed there
column4: and sent hopper cars containing corn into the creek. Traffic was rerouted for several days. In 2013
column5: a Jury awarded damages from BNSF to the engineer and conductor of the train.The Columbia Arena
column6: filming location for the Disney Movie D3: The Mighty Ducks
column7: was demolished in 2016 to make way for a new City Hall It was a controversial issue in that it was expected to cost $50 million and increase homeowner taxes by nineteen percent The Fridley Civic Campus dedication at 7071 University Avenue NE was held on November 17
column8: 2018. The staff had moved from the previous city hall over Veteran's day weekend and began working there on November 12. The City Council approved the project in December 2016 after nearly three years of studies
column9: meetings and workshops. The council raised the levy to pay for the project
column10: increasing city taxes by about 16 percent for the average homeowner. A number of other Twin Cities suburbs updated their civic facilities during a 2018 "building boom of sorts"

column1: Fridley is home to the Operational (formerly World) Headquarters of Ireland-based Medtronic plc. Medtronic also has a substantial Rice Creek business campus. Other major employers in Fridley include BAE Systems (formerly United Defense)
column2: Cummins
column3: Unity Medical Center
column4: part of the Allina Healthcare system
column5: part of the Mercy Hospitals
column9: and Park Construction Company.  Fridley is also home to a Target Stores retail distribution center. Magnum Research
column10: a company that produces the Desert Eagle firearm
column11: had its headquarters in Fridley until 2010.

column1: Both Minneapolis and Saint Paul draw their municipal water supplies from the Mississippi River at Fridley. The City of Minneapolis Waterworks plant and Fire Department training facility are within the city of Fridley.

column1: The public schools in Fridley are governed by Fridley Independent School District 14.  Fridley High School
column2: Fridley Middle School
column3: Hayes Elementary School
column4: and Stevenson Elementary School comprise the district. In 1978
column5: Fridley closed three elementary schools due to declining enrollment: Gardena
column7: and Parkview. The Riverwood Elementary school was demolished and single family homes were developed. The Parkview Elementary school became the Fridley Community center. The Gardena Elementary school location is now the Al-Amal school. The Rice Creek Elementary school was a fourth school closed later and demolished like Riverwood
column8: single family homes were developed. After the 1965 Tornado
column9: students at Parkview had to double up at the Riverwood school while it was being rebuilt.

column2: a private Roman Catholic high school
column3: Calvin Christian High School
column4: a private Christian high school
column5: and Al-Amal School

column1: A small portion of the northern part of Fridley lies within the Anoka-Hennepin School District 11.  Students living in an area of eastern Fridley are in the Columbia Heights School District 13. North Park elementary school is located in Fridley.  Most of the students living in the north-northeastern part of the city are in Spring Lake Park School District 16.

Fridley is home to the 127-acre (0.51 km2) Springbrook Nature Center park and nature reserve on its northern border with Coon Rapids. The total Fridley city park space is 316 acres (1.28 km2). There are baseball and softball diamonds
column2: football and soccer fields
column3: basketball courts
column4: and tennis courts for sports. In the winter there are outdoor skating rinks with warming houses. The western border of Fridley comprises the Mississippi National River and Recreation Area.  Portions of islands within the recreation area are within the Fridley city limits.

column1: Fridley has the following Anoka County parks within the city:
Manomin County Park (Rice Creek where it enters the Mississippi River and Locke Lake)
Rice Creek West/Locke Park and Regional Trail (Rice Creek)
Islands of Peace County Park (Mississippi River)
Anoka County Riverfront Regional Park (Mississippi River)

Interstate 694 and Minnesota State Highways 47 and 65 are three of the main routes in the city. East River Road is one of the oldest roads in the state as a Minnesota Territorial road. It was part of the Red River Oxcart Trail. The I-694 Bridge is the only crossing of the Mississippi River that connects the city directly.

The BNSF Railway main Northern transcontinental Twin Cities to Portland/Seattle double track line passes through Fridley as part of the Staples Subdivision.  The Fridley Station is served by the Northstar Commuter Rail line running on the BNSF tracks into Minneapolis. The Amtrak Empire Builder passes through Fridley twice daily on this line
column2: but does not stop within the city.  The massive BNSF Northtown Classification Yards are located in the city. The Minnesota Commercial Railway also serves Fridley
column3: with a terminal warehouse located there.

column1: The Mississippi River is non-navigable for barge traffic north of the Canadian Pacific Camden Place Rail Bridge; however
column2: small boats can travel upstream to the Coon Rapids Dam without a portage. There is a boat landing for small boats in the river near Interstate 694 at the Anoka County Riverfront Regional Park.The Anoka County–Blaine Airport serves the area and is located in neighboring Blaine.

column1: Fridley has the nickname "Friendly Fridley". The nickname was spread further by a long-running series of advertisements on various radio stations for a local car dealer. The announcer would direct people to "Friendly Chevrolet up in Friendly Fridley".
The city festival is named "49'er" days
column2: which commemorates the 1949 incorporation.  It is usually held in mid June.
Nord (France) - Medtronic plc has an assembly plant in Fourmies.

column1: Fridley has a Council-manager government. Scott Lund is the current Mayor
column2: first elected in 2000.

column1: Fridley is located in Minnesota's 5th congressional district
column2: represented by Ilhan Omar
column3: a Democrat. Ilhan became the first Somali American elected to the United States Congress. She was one of the first two Muslim women elected to Congress. Omar is also the first Somali American elected to Congress
column4: and the first woman of color to serve as a U.S. Representative from Minnesota.  She replaced Keith Ellison
column5: the first Muslim to be elected to the United States Congress.
